claim: Flublok is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).

extracted_evidence.quote: The production of RIV4 is based on a novel production platform in which recombinant HA (rHA) is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS)22.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote directly states that RIV4 (Flublok) is produced using a novel platform where recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system, matching the claim exactly.

extracted_evidence.quote: In brief, expresSF+ insect cells are infected with recombinant baculovirus carrying the relevant influenza HA genes, which are expressed under the control of a baculovirus polyhedrin promoter.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote provides specific details about the production process, confirming that insect cells are infected with recombinant baculovirus to express the HA gene, supporting the claim about the BEVS platform.

extracted_evidence.quote: This review focuses on the structural features of BEVS derived rHA that make RIV4 unique from conventional vaccines, and how these features help to maximise vaccine performance.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote confirms that RIV4 (Flublok) uses rHA derived from BEVS (baculovirus expression vector system), directly supporting the claim.

extracted_evidence.quote: Fig. 2 Structural features of native HA expressed on influenza virus and rHA produced in insect cells using the baculovirus expression vector system.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote explicitly states that rHA (recombinant HA) is produced in insect cells using the baculovirus expression vector system, which is the core of the claim.
